title_sort: edward carpenter to walt whitman, 17 may 1886
title: Edward Carpenter to Walt Whitman, 17 May 1886
text: Millthorpe nr Chesterfield17 May 1886Dear old Walt I just enclose a letter of credit for ￡45 on a bank in Philadelphia. It is the result of contributions, unsolicited, among a few friends R. D. Roberts of Cambridge MABessie H. Ford {of Leeds}Isabella FordCharles R Ashbee of Cambridge undergraduateWm Thompson of Nottingham& a brother & sisterand Myself. We shall be very pleased if you will accept the little present as our remembrance of your birthday & we wish you good times & much happiness yet—with our love. I have just heard from Maurice Bucke—he writes from Dorset, & talks of coming north in a fortnight, so I hope to see himEdward Carpenter I saw you had a good lecture in Phila. Letter from Edward Carpenter May 17 '86 (￡45 from friends birthday present) Edward Carpenter to Walt Whitman, 17 May 1886
